data.title: Loan shark targets ministry canteen
data.description: Two people have been arrested in the food court of the Ministry of Culture’s office in Huai Khwang district for loansharking, according to the Crime Suppression Division on Sunday.

data.title: PM on list of 100 most powerful women in world
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  is listed among the "100 World’s  Most Powerful Women  2024" by  Forbes Magazine .

data.title: Woman arrested after Thai-British beauty queen loses B4m in 'fake cop' scam
data.description: A woman, 40, was arrested in Chaiyaphum province for allegedly opening a  mule bank account  for a Cambodia-based  scam gang  that tricked Thai-British beauty queen  Charlotte Austin  out of 4 million baht.

data.title: Illegal Chinese construction workers arrested in Bangkok's ‘Little China’
data.description: Five Chinese men aged 34-61 were arrested in Bangkok

data.title: Saudi Arabian couple survive after Jet Ski capsizes off Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA: A Saudi Arabian couple were rescued safely after their Jet Ski capsized a few kilometres off Jomtien beach.

data.title: Bangkokians oppose congestion charge, support waste collection fee: poll
data.description: A majority of Bangkokians disagree with the planned traffic congestion charge in the capital but supported its new garbage collection fee aimed at encouraging waste separation, according to an opinion survey by the National Institute of Development Administration, or NIDA Poll.

data.title: Thailand's Hua Hin airport set to go 'international' next year
data.description: The Transport Ministry aims to upgrade Hua Hin Airport to be an international airport next year.

data.title: Thailand, South Korea teams to negotiate FTA, says Pichai
data.description: Thailand  and  South Korea  are prepared to negotiate a  free trade agreement  (FTA) to boost bilateral trade, services, and investment, Commerce Minister Pichai Naripthaphan said on Saturday.

data.description: The government

data.title: Concrete beam falls onto Rama IV Road, no injuries
data.description: Three vehicles were damaged but no one was hurt when a  concrete beam  fell from a  crane  at a building demolition site on Rama IV Road near the Lumpini intersection in  Bangkok  on Saturday evening.

data.title: Floods continue to batter southern Thailand
data.description: Renewed  flooding  battered many areas in the southern provinces of  Surat Thani  and  Nakhon Si Thammarat  on Saturday and has claimed two lives so far.

data.title: Fleeing Chinese murder suspect caught in Phuket
data.description: PHUKET — A Chinese national suspected of murder in his home country has been arrested at Phuket airport after arriving on a flight from Shanghai to the Thai resort island.

data.title: Flash flood catches Chumphon residents off guard
data.description: Video has surfaced of  Chumphon  residents being caught off guard by  flash floods , with many dismayed to see their furniture set afloat.

data.title: Myanmar fishing boat seized in Thai waters
data.description: RANONG: A Myanmar fishing boat has been confiscated and its six crewmen arrested for smuggling in this southern province after 40,000 kilogrammes of salt-fermented shrimp were found on board.

data.title: Saudi tourist rescued after 5 hours at sea off Pattaya
data.description: A Saudi Arabian woman was rescued after five hours at sea following a jet ski accident off the coast of Pattaya.

data.title: B300bn allocated for six double-track railway projects
data.description: The Transport Ministry aims to invest almost 300 billion baht to expand a raft of double railway tracks next year.

data.title: At least 3 killed, scores injured in grenade attack at Tak fair
data.description: At least three people were killed and scores injured when a grenade was thrown into an annual fair in the Umphang district of northern Tak province late on Friday night. Two Karen teenagers were subsequently arrested.
